definition: to run for shelter
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to alert/to warn/police
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]

sentences.english: The rain eventually returns during the party, and everyone except the women run for shelter.
sentences.chinese: 大雨期间，最终的回报党，大家除了妇女跑警报。

definition: Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
Ji Xianlin (1911-2009), Chinese linguist and Indologist
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Zhu Ziqing (1898-1948), poet and essayist
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Peiping or Beiping (name of Beijing at different periods, esp. 1928-1949)

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Li Jieren (1891-1962), novelist
Yuen Ren Chao (1892-1982), Chinese-American linguist
National Southwest Combined University (Peking, Tsinghua and Nankai Universities in exile in Kunming 1937-1945)
pinyin: Guo2 li4 Xi1 nan2 Lian2 he2 Da4 xue2
